title: Getting Started
text: sRm package contains selection functions methods handling, processing visualising Selective Reaction Monitoring (SRM) Multiple Reaction Monitoring (MRM) Liquid Chromatography Mass Spectrometry Data (LC-MS). key distinction SRM/MRM data LC-MS data data acquired time-series form chromatograms; whereas LC-MS (ie DIA, DDA, PRM) acquire data series mass spectrums can used create chromatograms. sRm designed make use existing packages (ie, much heavy lifting done mzR xcms) create simple S4 interface user processing, visualisation reporting. sRm can easily installed directly GitHub using remotes package.
code: remotes::install_github('wilsontom/sRm')

title: Getting Started
text: Open parse series .mzML files using openSRM function. backend argument either set mzR q3ML. (hopefully) instances mzR used backend, however due recent issue backward compatability pwiz mzR (see details) package q3ML pwiz independent parser SRM-MS .mzML files.
code: library(sRm) #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> Warning in system("timedatectl", intern = TRUE): running command 'timedatectl' #> had status 1 #> Loading required package: magrittr  chrom_files <- list.files(system.file('extdata/Shimadzu_LCD', package = 'sRm'), full.names = TRUE)  srmExp <- openSRM(chrom_files, source_type = 'lcd', backend = 'mzR')  srmExp #> ── SRM Object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────── sRm v0.2.3 ──  #>   #> SRM File Inputs: 4  #>   #> Transitions measured: 107  #>   #> Object Size: 2.5 Mb  #>

title: Getting Started
text: SRM object contains following data; tibble minimal amount meta data. tibble transitions names. Transitions given numeric index make accessing transitions easier plotting. tibble retention time (rt) intensity (int) values imported SRM chromatograms. tibble detected peaks SRM chromatogram. tibble formatted header data mzR::header()

title: Getting Started
text: main feature sRm series plotting methods useful visualising raw data. plotSRM method uses numeric index transition. can found transitions slot. plotSRM method two type options; overlay facet.
code: plotSRM(srmExp, index = 11, type = 'overlay') plotSRM(srmExp, index = 11, type = 'facet')

title: Getting Started
text: plotParent use numeric value parent mass input, plots SRM transitions feature selected parent mass.
code: plotParent(srmExp, 303)

title: Getting Started
text: sRm utilises xcms::peaksWithCentWave() function detection chromatogram features. plotPeakArea can used determine quality peak integration.
code: srmExpPeaks <-   detectPeaks(srmExp,               snthresh = 5,               peakwidth = c(5,75),                parallel = FALSE) plotPeakArea(srmExpPeaks, index = 5, sampleName = 'QC02')

title: Getting Started
text: peak detection performed, groupPeaks method can used assign features corresponding peak groups. parameter needs set rt_tolerance retention time width used group similar peaks together. summary peak groups can created using groupSummary method. output groupSummary method tibble can easily processed using dplyr produce list main GroupIDs need exporting analysis. example, can filter group low occupancy (suspiciously high occupancy), retention times wash phase chromatogram gradient peak width large. plotGroup method can also used visual inspection group.
code: srmExpGroups <- groupPeaks(srmExpPeaks, rt_tolerance = 0.5) group_table <- groupSummary(srmExpGroups)  head(group_table) #> # A tibble: 6 × 8 #> # Groups:   transition [3] #>   transition      GroupID    Rt Rtmin Rtmax Rtwidth      SN count #>   <chr>           <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> <int> #> 1 204 > 118.1 (+) G001     5.00  4.58  6.21   1.63     121.     4 #> 2 204 > 118.1 (+) G002     6.50  6.37  6.99   0.621  16561.     3 #> 3 204 > 144 (+)   G003     5.00  4.58  6.25   1.67  242567.     3 #> 4 204 > 144 (+)   G004     6.73  6.37  6.99   0.621  14830.     4 #> 5 204 > 162 (+)   G005     4.99  4.58  6.17   1.59     411      2 #> 6 204 > 162 (+)   G006     6.50  6.17  6.99   0.828   5285.     5 number_of_samples <- nrow(srmExp@meta)  # Only keep groups with have Rt width of 3.0 minutes or less and total group occupancy is less than or equal to the total number of samples.   group_table_filtered <-   group_table %>% dplyr::filter(Rt >= 1.0 & Rt <= 16.0) %>%   dplyr::filter(Rtwidth <= 3) %>% dplyr::filter(count <= number_of_samples) plotGroup(srmExpGroups, group = 'G001')

title: Getting Started
text: occasions (ie, standard optimisation) using data-driven approach peak grouping (detailed ) appropriate, targeted assays, target retention time (Rt) usually already known. Using createGroup method, peak groups created around specified Rt given tolerance.
code: srmExpGroupTarg <- createGroup(srmExpPeaks, index = 1, rt = 3.2,  width = 30, id = 'Group01')  srmExpGroupTarg@groups #> # A tibble: 4 × 12 #>   sampleID filter       rt rtmin rtmax    int   area     sn peakId trans…¹ index #>   <chr>    <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>   <int> #> 1 QC01     SRM SIC …  3.27  2.97  3.88 1.21e6 1.70e7 1.21e6      1 303 > …     1 #> 2 QC02     SRM SIC …  3.27  2.97  4.16 1.23e6 1.72e7 1.52e2      1 303 > …     1 #> 3 QC03     SRM SIC …  3.27  3.01  4.02 1.20e6 1.69e7 1.20e6      1 303 > …     1 #> 4 QC04     SRM SIC …  3.27  2.97  4.14 1.23e6 1.70e7 1.29e2      1 303 > …     1 #> # … with 1 more variable: GroupID <chr>, and abbreviated variable name #> #   ¹​transition patchwork::wrap_plots(   plotSRM(srmExpGroupTarg, index = 1),   plotGroup(srmExpGroupTarg, group = 'Group01'),   ncol = 1 )

title: Getting Started
text: available slots SRM object corresponding accessor method can used retrieve slot contents, instead use; object@<slot_name>.

title: SRM — SRM-class
text: S4 class store single reaction monitoring (SRM) mass spectrometry (MS) data

title: SRM — SRM-class
text: meta tibble minimal amount meta data. transitions tibble transitions names chroms tibble retention time (rt) intensity (int) values imported SRM chromatograms peaks tibble detected peaks groups tibble peak information user defined groups header tibble formatted header data mzR::header()

code: adjustBaseline(object, hwm)  # S4 method for SRM adjustBaseline(object, hwm = 6)

sRm v0.2.3
text: Add parallel support via future_map openSRM detectPeaks Add keepTransitions method remove redundant data SRM objects

title: sRm V0.2.2
text: Use CentWave algorithm peak detection Remove explicit slot transformed chromatograms Standardise transition naming Add peakAsymmetry method Add method creating peak groups Export results using peak group IDs Add backend argument openSRM. Select either mzR (Default) q3ML (hopefully short term solution mzML files converted using newer versions pwiz, currently supported mzR.

title: sRm v0.2.0
text: Breaking Changes Multiple file input. SRM objects can used single mzML files batch mode multiple files Basic support peak smoothing (Savitzky-Golay implemented present) Support chromatogram feature detection (pracma & xcms matchedFilter) Improved plotting methods Complete re-write openSRM function underlying methods previous methods form v0.1.4 lower; now deprecated

title: sRm v0.1.4
text: main change extraction decoding chromatogram time intensity arrays now performed mzR. xml2 still used extraction header data currently unsupported mzR lot internal workings updated / replaced efficent approaches; mainly utilising dplyr, tibble purrr New method export_to_skyline exports SRM transitions format can saved .csv uploaded Skyline peaks slot SRM-object now list tibbles index slot SRM-object incorporates polarity (- +) SRM-object headeris now tibble Bug fix plotAll caused multiple outputs layering plots Bug fix plotMulti caused switching colours geom_lines labels Bug fix plotAll causing new index order created Additional labelling options (default custom) plotMulti Added vignette

title: sRm v0.1.3
text: Add plotMulti easy graphical representation complex SRM-MS chromatograms Cleaned filter naming throughout Fixed CI build environment, longer list unnecessary Imports DESCRIPTION openSRMfile wasn’t checking file compression assuming file converted compression. openSRMfile now checks zlib compression found passes gzip compression type arg sRm::decodePeaks Instrument, Instrument Model Instrument Serial separate fields meta method Internal helper function add (scanPolarity) extract scan polarity cvParam insert object@header Parent (Q1) product (Q3) masses extracted cvParams using getQMZs longer string processed filter names filter slot added SRM class. contains raw copy idRefs object@header now includes scan polarity; -1 = negative, 1 = positive totalIonCount become totIonCount improve readability circumstances; transition set needs consider retention window aswell parent m/z Unique filter ID strings created parsed idRefs Rt lengths unequal within unique transitions set; (now) removed transitions class -screen message stating idRefs dropped

title: sRm v0.1.2
text: Fix visible binding' NOTE 'ggplot2 Update manual Increase test coverage

title: sRm v0.1.1
text: Adapt combineTransitions catch SRM’s different lengths Result combineTransitions now S3 class Plot method combineTransitions class ;(plotAll) Plot method single transition events; (plotSRM) Bug fixed time intensity arrays encoded different precisions grid gridExtra listed Dependencies

title: sRm v0.1.0
text: First stable release Reading parsing Thermo TSQ Vantage SRM data Single function reading decoding peaks; stored S4 object S4 method combining transitions unique parent (Q1) m/z value S4 methods viewing object: show, meta, transitions Basic tests (testthat + codecov) Travis AppVeyor Continuous Integration Passes R CMD check ERRORS WARNINGS
